channel.title: Home on Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc.
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc.

item.title: History
item.description: The MLBCSI was founded to continue, enhance and actualize the Christian Education Nurture – Children’s Ministry (CEN) of the church. The objectives of the CEN include “the creation of a teaching and learning environment that nurtures faith, builds communities and enhances the response of people to God’s call to mission; and the strengthening of the faith journey of the members of the congregation that they may realize, experience and live a life acceptable to God”.

item.title: Vision
item.description: The Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. envisions to be a leading Christian institution.

item.title: Mission
item.description: The Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. commits to provide quality Christian Education that best serves its people and community.

item.title: Excellence
item.description: EXCELLENCE in achieving the highest standards of quality, performance, and continuous improvement in the pursuit of one’s full potential.

item.title: Leadership
item.description: LEADERSHIP that empowers individuals to take initiative, demonstrate responsibility, and contribute positively inside and outside the school community.

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: Address 85 Osmeña Boulevard Barangay Sta. Cruz, 6000 Cebu City Email Address mlbcsi.cebu@gmail.com | mlbcsifinance@gmail.com Contact Number 032-2723443 Facebook Page MatildaBradfordOfficial

item.title: Respect
item.description: RESPECT to others regardless of differences by treating them with courtesy, consideration, and kindness and creating an inclusive and supportive environment where students, educators, and staff feel valued and safe.

item.title: 1. How do we apply for a student ID?
item.description: Applications must be done online following this link: https://forms.office.com/r/K9wWpqwYxM

item.title: 3. How do we inquire about carpool service providers?
item.description: Please give us a call through 3454378 loc 1134 and we will be happy to provide some information and answer your questions regarding our serviced routes and carpool service providers.

item.title: 4. Can parents stay inside the campus?
item.description: Nullam at urna nisi. Curabitur luctus et eros ac egestas. Aliquam maximus imperdiet felis, eu egestas ex faucibus vel. Aliquam eleifend nunc ac bibendum tristique. Etiam a lectus vel diam bibendum pretium ultrices quis justo. Phasellus eu elementum velit.

item.title: 5. What is the standard protocol once someone is Covid positive? Is proof of vaccination compulsory?
item.description: When someone becomes Covid positive, the medical team will identify the close contacts and determine based on proximity and circumstances if they are low risk, medium risk or high risk. The Covid positive is prohibited from entering the campus. He/she has to finish the isolation period before he/she can be allowed to come back to school with clearance from the school physician. Proof of vaccination is needed by the medical team to help us determine period of isolation and quarantine.

item.title: 6. How do we ensure that our students are safe?
item.description: We have established health and safety protocols which are being practiced by all members of the school community, even guests and visitors who come to the campus to transact official business.

item.title: 1. When will the entrance exam schedules for SY2024-2025?
item.description: Grade School - Grade 1 date 1 date 2 date 3 date 4 date 5 date 6 date 7 date 8 Junior High School - Grade 7 date 1 date 2 date 3 date 4 date 5 date 6 date 7 date 8 Senior High School - Grade 11 date 1 date 2 date 3 Other Grade Levels (Grades 2-6, 8-10) date 1 date 2 date 3 date 4 date 5 date 6 date 7

item.title: 2. What does the Entrance Exam cover?
item.description: Coverage of Entrance Exam by department: Early Ed : Readiness Test and General Information, Intelligence Test (Pictorial) Grade 1 : Intelligence Test, Achievement Tests in English and Math, Oral Reading Grades 2-10 : Intelligence Test, Achievement Tests in English, Math, and Science Grades 11 : Essay, Intelligence Test, Aptitude Tests, Interview

item.title: 3. Are Filipino subjects included in the Entrance Exam?
item.description: No. Achievement Tests usually just cover the major subjects namely, English, Math, and Science.

item.title: 4. How long is the Entrance/Qualifying Exam?
5. What to bring during the exam?
item.description: The things to bring during the exam are indicated in the exam permit: pencils, pen, eraser, ruler, snacks, water and the exam permit with picture.

item.title: 6. Can the student applicant just come and take the test anytime he/she wants to?
item.description: No. All Tests and interviews are scheduled. For Early Ed, the test interviews are by appointment. All pupil and student applicants are required to secure an exam permit before coming to a scheduled exam.

item.title: 7. Is there a retake for those who failed in the Entrance Exam?
item.description: Exams and test appointments and interviews can be rescheduled like when a student gets sick or has an emergency, but those who failed in the exam cannot take the same test again. They may, however, reapply for the following school year subject to a reevaluation and deliberation by the Admissions Committee.

item.title: 8. How long before we can know the application decision?
item.description: The Office of Admissions and Scholarship will inform you within 5 working days after the exam/interview for Nursery 1 to Grade 10 applicants. Grade 11 applicants will be notified of the results by 3rd week of April 2024.

item.title: Library Resources
item.description: A. DOST STARBOOKS ONLINE– The 1st Philippine Science Digital Library Contains thousands of digitized science and technology resources in various formats placed in specially designed “pods” set in a user-friendly interface To access the database: www.testbook.com B. EBSCOhost Offers high quality articles licensed from reputable publishers chosen to meet the specific needs of researchers To access the database: URL : http://test.test.com/ C. GALE DATABASES Gale offers a variety of resources for education, lifelong learning, and academic research.

item.title: Vision/Mission Statement
item.description: The LRC aims to promote a wholistic formation of the students as well as the faculty and the whole community through developing enthusiasm and passion for reading by providing a rich and relevant collection of reading and audio visual materials to meet the recreational, cultural, spiritual, emotional, and academic needs of the community.

item.title: Learning Resource Center
item.description: The Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. Learning Resource Center (LRC) is an integral part of the School and contributes to the realization of its objectives by providing and making available materials and services needed for the students’ formation and education. LRC provides services mainly to MLBCSI students, faculty, administration and the school staff.

item.title: Health and Safety
item.description: The Safety and Security Office (SSO) ensures the delivery of programs, services, and activities in the areas of safety and security including, but not limited to health and sanitation, campus traffic, security, campus emergency incidents and the implementation of the School-based Disaster Risk Reduction Management Plan. The office plans, and monitors all campus emergency incidents in addition to the school-based disaster risk reduction and management activities. It works closely with other offices such as the Physical Plant Office in conducting regular in campus risk and hazard assessments, and makes appropriate recommendations for safety.

item.title: Commitments Services
item.description: Its commitments and services include: To deliver and implement culture and arts programs; To recognize and acknowledge MLBCSI artistic potentials and cultural & historical heritages; To develop and sustain artistic resources for the school’s community; To provide alternative artistic enrichment activities aligned with the academic requirements of the school for avenues of holistic and interactive educational environment; To create policies for the development of culture and the arts in the school; To lead in attaining a sustainable eminence in culture and the arts complementary with other institutions and schools in Central Visayas; To forge partnerships, linkages and collaborations with local counterparts, patrons, national and international culture and the arts funding institutions and agencies.

item.title: Culture and Arts Program
item.description: Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. Arts and Culture Programs draw on the potency, power and relevance of culture, in particular artistic and expressive culture rooted in Ignatian ideals, to help build and maintain the core values of the school, promoting the competencies of the progressively growing community and building character of the recipient populace. The thrust of achieving balanced programming is exemplified in the continuous enriching and engaging events and projects related to both international and local culture & arts appreciation and development of the students, and the school community in general.

item.title: Sports Academy
item.description: SPORTS ACADEMY (to start September 15, 2022) A developmental grassroots program starting from age 6 in the different sports. item.title: Accreditation & Affiliationss
item.description: PEAC Accredited since 2016, granting government subsidies to a number of students through the Educational Service Contracting (ESC) program A partner of the Global Initiative for Exchange and Development (GIED), a non-governmental organization dedicated to empowering individuals and fostering connectivity through volunteerism and community-building for sustainable development. A partner and supporter of UCCP-Bradford Feed My Lambs Ministry that envisions its beneficiaries to be free from all forms of poverty in life.

item.title: History
item.description: Church leaders of the United Church of Christ in the Philippines (UCCP), Bradford Church, organized and established the Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. (MLBCSI) on February 11,1996. The MLBCSI was founded to continue, enhance and actualize the Christian Education Nurture – Children’s Ministry (CEN) of the church. The objectives of the CEN include “the creation of a teaching and learning environment that nurtures faith, builds communities and enhances the response of people to God’s call to mission; and the strengthening of the faith journey of the members of the congregation that they may realize, experience and live a life acceptable to God”.

item.title: MLBCSI
item.description: The Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. envisions to be a leading Christian institution. It commits to provide quality Christian Education that best serves its people and community.

item.title: Character Prefects
item.description: Discipline is a shared and complementary effort of all school authorities, “the substitute parents.” As a community that cares for one another, Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. views school discipline as a shared effort among adult community members – the teachers, staff and administrators. The Character Prefect Offices of the Student Formation of the Grade School, Junior High, and Senior High School departments play an active role in the observance and promotion of discipline.

item.title: Guidance Services
item.description: The Guidance Services of each department offers a variety of programs and services for the holistic and mental well-being of the student in the spirit of cura personalis.

item.title: MEET THE LEADERS FOR STUDENT FORMATION

item.title: Varsity Program
item.description: Comprehensive program of multi-events for 10 to 18 years old (ladderized program for boys & girls) Training (year-round) Competitions (scheduled across the year) Compete in competitions locally, nationally and even internationally. VARSITY PROGRAM SPORTS/EVENTS Basketball Volleyball Football Futsal Taekwondo Lawn Tennis Table Tennis Athletics (Track and Field) Swimming Triathlon

item.title: Goal
item.description: Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. aims to be recognized as an academic institution known for its quality education (academics) with one of the best sports program in Cebu whose students are well-rounded in academics and sports

item.title: Social Involvement
item.description: Through the Student Formation Program and the Campus Ministry and Social Involvement Office (CMSIO), the school’s mission is to form men and women for others, who are committed to promoting social justice, peace, and environmental sustainability. The social involvement programs aim to foster a sense of social responsibility, empathy, and compassion among the students. These programs provide opportunities for the students to engage in service projects and outreach programs that address the needs of the less fortunate and marginalized sectors of society.

item.title: Student Activity Program (SAP)
item.description: The Student Activity Program (SAP) of Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. aims to provide students with opportunities to participate in various activities outside of the academic curriculum. The SAP is designed to promote holistic development, enhance students’ skills and talents, and provide a platform for socialization and community involvement. To know more about the Student Activity Program (SAP) of each department, visit the link below.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: The Senior High School Department of this school continues the mission of forming young men and women through holistic Ignatian education as expressed in the school’s vision and mission statements. Furthermore, the department works with the entire school towards the goals of formation as outlined in the profile of an Ateneo Hearter graduate in general. In particular, the Senior High School Department positions itself as preparatory for college, for work, and for life by providing structures and learning experiences to form students of excellence, leadership, and service.

item.title: Accounting, Business, and Management (ABM)
item.description: An LOREM IPSUM DOLOR ABM student .. prepares for global adaptation by developing “strategic agility” as a needed skill to thrive in a world that is D-VUCAD: Diverse, Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous, and Disruptive (Social Entrepreneurship) aims to become a pioneer of innovation by appreciating the significance of business interests as well as the importance of contributing better and stable jobs to society (Labor Laws). practices ethical leadership through agile programs that advocate corporate governance and honesty in the conduct of business (Business Ethics and Corporate Social Responsibility).

item.title: Humanities and Social Sciences (HUMSS)
item.description: An LOREM IPSUM DOLOR HUMSS student .. prepares for global adaptation by developing “strategic agility” as a needed skill to thrive in a world that is D-VUCAD: Diverse, Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous, and Disruptive (Social Entrepreneurship) aims to become a pioneer of innovation by appreciating the significance of business interests as well as the importance of contributing better and stable jobs to society (Labor Laws). practices ethical leadership through agile programs that advocate corporate governance and honesty in the conduct of business (Business Ethics and Corporate Social Responsibility).

item.title: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM)
item.description: An LOREM IPSUM DOLOR STEM student… prepares for global adaptation by developing “strategic agility” as a needed skill to thrive in a world that is D-VUCAD: Diverse, Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous, and Disruptive (Social Entrepreneurship) aims to become a pioneer of innovation by appreciating the significance of business interests as well as the importance of contributing better and stable jobs to society (Labor Laws). practices ethical leadership through agile programs that advocate corporate governance and honesty in the conduct of business (Business Ethics and Corporate Social Responsibility).

item.title: A Soulful Harmony of Prayers to Concert: The Road to UCCP Bradford's Main Sanctuary Restoration
item.description: UCCP Bradford’s “Huni sa Grasya ug Gugma” concert for a cause was held last February 24, 2024, at 6:00 pm at the IEC Convention Center. This was made for the restoration of UCCP Bradford Main Sanctuary.

item.title: Aiming for the Hoop, A Joyous 3rd Place Win for the MLBCSI's Basketball Team
item.description: The MLBCSI’s Basketball team placed 3rd in the overall finals for the South District 2 Meet.

item.title: Buwan ng Wika: Hearts Ablaze Toward Culture
item.description: “Buhay pa ba ang alab sa puso mo?” A touching inquiry from the movie GomBurZa, directed by Pepe Diokno, asked. This thought-provoking question challenges the hearts of the Filipinos. It pushes us to question how close we are to the tapestry of our heritage. The first event of the school year, Buwan ng Wika, reminds us of our culture and identity.

item.title: Buwan Ng Wika: Igniting Patriotism
item.description: On August 31, 2023, Matilda L. Bradford Christian School Inc. celebrated Buwan ng Wika with the participation of students, parents, and faculty. ⁤⁤From the Lakan and Lakambini pageant to the Sabayang Pagbikas competition, the festivity encourages the preservation of Filipino heritage.

item.title: Buwan ng Wika: The Passion of the Filipino
item.description: The Buwan ng Wika is a special time in all of the Philippines where everyone wears the traditional attire of the Philippines. It is a month to celebrate our culture. A month to appreciate ourselves and our language, Filipino. We hold this every year to commemorate our ancestors, and thank them for their service.

item.title: EDSA Revolution: A Rally to Remember
item.description: On February 22, 1986, the People Power Revolution, also known as the EDSA Revolution, occurred. It was a momentous time in history that showcased the power the people have when they get together and fight for it.

item.title: MLBCSI Celebrates its 28th Founding Anniversary
item.description: The highly awaited event of this school year has finally come. The Matilda L. Bradford Christian School celebrates its 28th Founding Anniversary and Intramurals starting February 11 - 16, 2024. The faculty and staff together with the Board of Trustees led the MLBCSI Sunday at United Church of Christ in the Philippines (UCCP) - Bradford on February 11, 2024.

item.title: Science and Math Month: Curiosity Stirs Discoveries
item.description: From mere atoms, we have evolved into the powerful civilizations we inhabit today. As you stand amidst this technological age, have you wondered, “How did we get here?”. The plethora of theories, equations, and formulas aid us in our routines and understanding of the world.

item.title: The Gymnasium Heats Up as the Elementary Boy's Badminton Championship Game Takes Place
item.description: February 14th, the day the elementary boys’ badminton took place. After winning the semi-finals, both Nathan Quinapondan from the Grade 6 and Karlisle from the Grade 5 fought in the championship game.
